items.title: How to fight the affordable housing and climate crises at once
items.description:
Members of a church fix up a house in Amity Township, Pennsylvania. Homes in a state of disrepair are not eligible for federal weatherization money, contributing to higher energy bills. | Ben Hasty/MediaNews Group/Reading Eagle via Getty Images
    

  It’s all about the energy ...

items.title: How China’s Zero Covid policy is failing Shanghai
items.description:
A man with a mask is seen through a window at his home in a residential area on April 13, 2022 in Shanghai, China. Some 25 million people in Shanghai are in the second week of a strict lockdown, after a surge in Omicron cases. | Getty Images
    

  Rare dissent flares in ...

items.title: How to handle a lopsided friendship
items.description:
Getty Images/iStockphoto
    

  If you think a pal is way less (or way more) invested than you are, here’s what to do. Kristen’s 12-year relationship with her best friend Heather was put to the test during the pandemic. (Both women’s names have been changed at Kristen’s request ...

items.title: The banned weapon Russia (and the US) won’t give up
items.description: Why war crime investigators are looking for cluster bombs in Ukraine. In Ukraine, human rights investigators like Amnesty International and Bellingcat have been tracking Russian attacks to aid in a potential war crimes investigation. One thing they’re paying special attention to ...

items.title: Everything Everywhere All at Once, explained by a quantum physicist
items.description:
This is Michelle Yeoh in the very fantastic Everything Everywhere All at Once. In it she plays a mom, and her story made me want to call my mom. | Courtesy of A24
    

  The probability that we’re all living in the multiverse, and why that idea is so appealing. This past ...

items.title: It’s time to think outside the mask mandate
items.description: A family wearing masks visits the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History in Washington, DC, on March 17. The city’s indoor masking mandate expired in February, but some area college campuses have recently reinstated indoor mask requirements due to rising Covid-19 case ...

items.title: In Her Body and Other Parties, Carmen Maria Machado knows where the bodies are buried
items.description:
Graywolf Press
    

  The Vox Book Club’s April pick is a tour de force short story collection. The Vox Book Club is linking to Bookshop.org to support local and independent booksellers.
In Carmen Maria Machado’s dazzling debut short story collection Her Body and Other Parties, ...

items.title: The case for regret
items.description:
Getty Images
    

  Regrets, I’ve had a few, and they’re good actually. Should we embrace our regrets?
My intuition on this question has always pushed me in the opposite direction. If there are any truly wasted emotions, regret and worry seem like good candidates — emotions ...

items.title: One Good Thing: 32 years after its debut, Microsoft Solitaire is still a blissful time-waster
items.description:
“Oh, hey, you can put that black four under that red five,” says a helpful person looking over your shoulder. | Microsoft
    

  It’s time to celebrate the calming vibes of computer solitaire in this messed-up world we live in. A couple of months ago, I bought a new computer ...

items.title: How war in Ukraine is making people hungry in the Middle East
items.description:
A baker prepares the traditional bread product manoushe in the Lebanese city of Chtaura. | Vassilis Poularikas/NurPhoto via Getty Images

items.description: As of April 15, 2022, I have spent 12,075 days behind bars for a 1989 crime I was convicted of committing at age 15. It would be the first and only arrest during my childhood. Since then, I have languished behind bars for more than two-thirds of my life, living in a veritable ...
